channel.title: @mitb
channel.description:
Hasn't it been up?
Isn't it still in beta though? Do an official launch, put an advertisement up in the RSC Server section. Post an announcement of the RSC server for any RS2 related people to see if they would like to try it out. Also add a hiscores, we need to know the competition.

item.title: @mitb
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“KO9, post:10, topic:445983”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=548841.msg4079999#msg4079999 date=1345266499]
Actually… if the beta server is online we can turn it into official mode (without mysql)
The thing is people won’t play it.
[/quote]
You’ll never know until you try.[/quote]

Well once we complete the website we can always try.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: @mitb
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

CodeForFame:

I’m sure if you went through with that thing I PMed you about, in early May, there would be more development.

Read full topic

item.title: @mitb
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:445983”]It can’t really be launched as-is though, can it? The whole point of this server from the beginning was that the community would develop it, I would host it. I’m hosting it, and even went to a lot of work to make it automatically update when a change is pushed to github, so the developers have to do no work to update the server after they write their code.

What else can I do short of developing the server myself, which I don’t have the time to do right now? If there is anything I can do to help, I certainly will.[/quote]I’m sure if you went through with that thing I PMed you about, in early May, there would be more development.

Read full topic

item.title: @mitb
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It can’t really be launched as-is though, can it? The whole point of this server from the beginning was that the community would develop it, I would host it. I’m hosting it, and even went to a lot of work to make it automatically update when a change is pushed to github, so the developers have to do no work to update the server after they write their code.

What else can I do short of developing the server myself, which I don’t have the time to do right now? If there is anything I can do to help, I certainly will.

Read full topic

item.title: @mitb
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

imthenull:

To be honest, I think this project will take forever to get to a point where it’s made public. It had a lot of hype in the beginning, now, it seems like no one cares.

That’s because of lack of development from the start. Nobody wants to work on it alone, and that’s what they have to do to get this game out at some point.

Read full topic
